completions.nl_description: Move all objects to the positions that objects of the same color would reach if they were extended.
Move all objects to the bottom row and recolor them.
Rotate the color of each column of objects 90 degrees clockwise within the column.
Move all objects of color other than O, if they are neighbors, towards the object of color O.
Move all objects one step down and then recolor them to the colors of other objects they moved to.
Move all objects of color different than O one step up.
Move all objects to the position of the neighboring object, forming stacked pairs.
Move all objects to a new position based on their initial neighbors.
Move all objects of a non-color O and recolor the resulting cells in the color of neighboring objects.
Move all objects of color different than O towards the object of color O they are neighbors of, and then recolor them to the color of the neighbor.
Move all objects of size 1 to the top of other objects
Move all objects of minimum size toward the object of maximum size, without overlapping.
Move all objects neighboring another object one step down, and then recolor them to the neighbors' colors.
Move all objects of color A, Y, and W to the bottom row of the grid.
Move all objects of even size to the right and recolor them to color O.
Move the objects that are not surrounded by other objects to the space where other objects currently exist.
Move all objects of size 2 one position down and then recolor them to the color of the neighboring object.
Recolor all objects neighboring the object of size 4 to black.
Move all non-border objects one step down and recolor them to the colors of the former top-border objects.
Move all objects of size 2 one step down, and then recolor them to color Y.
Move all objects of color different than 'O' to a specific set of positions in the output grid.
Move all objects of color different than O that are present in the grid corners, rightward
Move all objects of size 2 toward the smallest object, without overlapping.
Move all objects of color different than O, toward each other if they are neighbors, and then recolor them based on size and position.
Move all objects of size 1 toward the object of size 2, without overlapping, and then update their color.
Move all objects of color to a new position and recolor them, respecting the order of appearance.
Move all objects to match their neighbors' grid positions, and recolor to match their neighbors.
For each pair of neighboring objects, move one object to the position of the other object, if their colors are different.
Move all objects of size 1 toward the object of maximum size until they hit another object, without overlapping.
Move all objects towards another neighboring object, if they have the same size, without overlapping.
Move each object one step downwards
Move all objects of color different than O, toward the object of color O, if they are neighbors of it.
Move all objects toward the location of the object of size 2, in a maximal way.
Move the objects of size 4 to the position of adjacent objects, while retaining their colors.
Move all objects of non-black color towards each other if they are neighbors and of different colors. Then, update their colors to maintain the neighborhood relationships.
Move all objects of color to an empty cell that maximizes their distance from their original cells.
Move all objects of shape enclosed to a neighboring object.
Move all objects of color different than O to the position of the next object along the diagonal
Move all objects of color different than O one step down.
Move all objects of size 2 to the position of the neighboring object of size 1, then recolor them.
Move all objects of size 1 to the center of the object cluster, changing their color to F and W respectively.
Move all objects of size 2, preserving their relative position
Move all objects of color different than O, toward the center line if they are neighbors of any object not in the center line.
Move all objects towards each other without overlap.
Move all objects of size 1 toward the nearest object.
Move all objects of size 1 toward the object of minimum size.
For each pair of neighbor objects, swap the positions of the objects.
Move horizontally adjacent objects to color F and vertically adjacent objects to color A.
Move all objects of color different than O toward the object of size 1 they neighbor, and transform to color F and W.
Move all objects of color different than O to the positions of any immediate neighbors.
Move all objects to the nearest neighboring position of another object.
Move all objects of size 1 toward the nearest object of size 4, without overlapping.
Move all objects of size 1 toward the nearest neighboring object of size 2.
Move all objects toward the first object found in the grid.
Reposition objects with neighbors and recolor to match the new neighbors.
Move all single-cell objects to the top left corner without overlapping.
Move all objects to the center of the largest square cluster.
Move all objects A, Y, W, B, and F toward the object types X, C, or G.
Move all the objects of size 1 to the diagonal of the objects of size 4.
Move objects of size 2, filling a grid 4 with the first object in f and the fifth object with y
Move all objects one column to the right
Move all objects of color C and size 4 toward the center in a cross pattern and recolor them.
Move all objects one step down and then recolor them based on their neighbor's color.
Move the diagonal neighbors of height 2x2 to positions that form a diagonal line.
Move all objects toward each other if they are neighbors, and recolor them to match the original object color.
Move all single-pixel objects to the positions of the corner-pixel objects.
Move all adjacent objects toward the objects of color different than O, and then recolor them.

Move and recolor all objects of size 2, based on their position in the list, such that each object's final position aligns vertically with the grid row index of the next object resulting in a specific pattern.
Move all objects to form a diagonal line from the top-left to bottom-right, preserving their order in the original grid.
Move all objects of size 2 to the locations of objects of size 4.
Move all objects of size 2 and above one step down and recolor them sequentially based on their current position.
Move all objects on the grid one step down.
Move all objects of size 2 one step up, if they are neighbors of the object of size 1.
Move all objects of size 1 towards the center of the grid.
Move all objects to the nearest neighboring empty cell (O).
Move all objects of size 1 toward the closest object until they are adjacent, without overlapping.
Move all objects one cell down, and recolor them with their neighbor's colors.
Move all objects of shape square one step to the right.
Move all objects of color different than O toward their neighbors, then recolor each to the color of the neighbor they moved toward.
Swap the positions of objects of adjacent, same-sized pairs.
Rotate all square-shaped objects 90 degrees clockwise
Move all objects of size greater than 1 to the last row and last column.
Swap colors of neighboring objects.
Move all objects of size 1 to the position previously occupied by the objects of size 2.
Move objects of size 1 to the center of the maximum size object, without overlapping.
Move all objects one step down and then change their colors based on the color of the closest object in the original grid.
Rotate all objects of size 2 by 90 degrees.
Move all objects toward the positions of the objects in the bottom-left triangle, if they are neighbors of it.
Move all objects of color other than O to the right, if they are neighbors of another object.

Move all objects toward the neighbor objects and recolor them. Each object is moved in the direction where its neighbor object is positioned, and then recolored to the color of the original neighbor object.
Move all objects one step down.
Move all objects diagonally adjacent to an object of color O towards each other and swap their colors.
Randomly shuffle objects within the grid.
Move all objects by rotating their positions counter-clockwise around the center of the grid without overlapping.
Move all objects to the top left and assign them new random positions within the grid.

Rotate all objects clockwise by 90 degrees and then recolor them based on their column in the input grid, where the top-left corner of the input grid starts with A and subsequent colors are filled column-wise.
Move all isolated objects (of size 1) together with the largest object in each grid.
Move all objects of color different than O to their leftmost available position.
Move all objects toward the object that is diagonally adjacent, if they are neighbors, and recolor them with the color of the diagonally adjacent object.
Move all objects of color different than C, towards the object of color C if they are neighboring it, then recolor them based on a preset pattern.
Swap all pairs of objects of size 2.
Move all objects of size 1 toward the nearest distinct pair of objects, and recolor them.
Move all objects toward the center of the grid in diagonal directions.

Move all objects to the right and recolor them based on adjacent objects. The objects are recolored as follows: Orange to Yellow, Blue to Green, Cyan to Red, Yellow to White, Red to Black, Fuchsia to Blue, and White to Fuchsia.
Move all objects of color different than O towards the closest object of color O, if they are neighbors.
Move all objects toward the target object lightest in color, without overlapping.
Move all objects to the position of the nearest object, without overlapping, and then recolor them to match the nearest object's color.
Move floating objects to the top of previously occupied cells, keeping the new vertical order.
Move all objects located around the bottom left half-rectangle formed by the C objects towards the top left area of the grid
Move all objects inside the rectangle towards the closest edge of the rectangle.
Move all the objects to positions of objects different than O, if they are neighbors of them.
Move all objects of color to one cell down, then recolor each object to the color of the object that is diagonally adjacent to it.
